intro: Justicia schreiteri, commonly known as the pink fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy bracts that resemble small lanterns. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Justicia schreiteri is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
